intro: Helianthemum ocymoides var. psilocladum, commonly known as the psilocladum sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a low-growing shrub with small, fleshy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and drought tolerance. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
